criterion: Provides false or misleading information about the effect of singing to the baby during pregnancy on their intelligence.
Does not mention the potential risks of excessive singing to the baby during pregnancy.
Provides evidence-based information on the effects of singing to the baby during pregnancy on their intelligence.
Asks the user to clarify their query or provides a relevant example to better understand their concern.
Uses technical jargon or overly complicated language that is difficult for a non-medical professional to understand.
Does not provide any information about the effect of singing to the baby during pregnancy on their intelligence.
Provides a balanced view of the potential benefits and risks of singing to the baby during pregnancy.
Fails to provide evidence-based information on the effects of singing to the baby during pregnancy on their intelligence.
Provides information on the potential benefits of singing to the baby during pregnancy, but does not address the risks.
Provides information on the effects of singing to the baby during pregnancy on their intelligence in a clear and concise manner.
